cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi E of Havana, Cuba and 115 mi S of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest to north along the Florida west coast Tuesday–Wednesday and then accelerating north-northeast toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Florida Keys (Craig Key to Dry Tortugas) and Florida west coast from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and entire west coast of Florida, later coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Squalls could bring brief tropical-storm-force gusts (25–35 mph sustained, higher gusts)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Palm Beach
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Elsa may drop 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches, producing urban ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Tuesday across the Florida Peninsula including Palm Beach County
